lead_paragraph: Myanmar’s departing government has lifted a nearly four-year curfew in Rakhine, where clashes between Rohingya Muslims and Buddhists left more than 200 people dead.

headline.print_headline: Asia; Myanmar: State Curfew Is Lifted

snippet: Myanmar’s departing government has lifted a nearly four-year curfew in Rakhine, where clashes between Rohingya Muslims and Buddhists left more than 200 people dead.
abstract: Myanmar's president Thein Sein lifts four-year curfew in western state of Rakhine, site of clashes between minority Muslims and majority Buddhists.
